question.text: A beam of α- particle is incident on a gold foil. Corresponding to the incident beams A,B and C , the emergent beams A′,B′,and C′ . The transmission and deflection of α- particles through the foil take place such that

options.text: the number of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi><mo>-</mo></math> particle in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  is maximum and in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  minimum

the number of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi><mo>-</mo></math> particles in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  is minimum and in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  maximum

the number of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi><mo>-</mo></math> particles in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math> ,  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  and in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  is the same.

the number of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi><mo>-</mo></math> particles in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  is minimum and in  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  maximum

solution.text:
From figure, we can see that B is reflected totally, so transmission of B is minimum.

But A is passing through foil with minimum deviation.

Therefore, transmission of A is maximum.
